+1 Blowgun Needles (50).text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Found On: Magic Item Table B

+1 Breastplate.name: +1 Breastplate
+1 Breastplate.text: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+1 Chain Mail.name: +1 Chain Mail
+1 Chain Mail.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

+1 Chain Shirt.name: +1 Chain Shirt
+1 Chain Shirt.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+1 Club.name: +1 Club
+1 Club.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Crossbow Bolt.name: +1 Crossbow Bolt
+1 Crossbow Bolt.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Found On: Magic Item Table B

+1 Crossbow Bolts (20).name: +1 Crossbow Bolts (20)
+1 Crossbow Bolts (20).text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Found On: Magic Item Table B

+1 Dagger.name: +1 Dagger
+1 Dagger.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Dart.name: +1 Dart
+1 Dart.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: +1 Double-Bladed Scimitar
+1 Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Flail.name: +1 Flail
+1 Flail.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Glaive.name: +1 Glaive
+1 Glaive.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Greataxe.name: +1 Greataxe
+1 Greataxe.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Greatclub.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Greatsword.name: +1 Greatsword
+1 Greatsword.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Halberd.name: +1 Halberd
+1 Halberd.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Half Plate Armor.name: +1 Half Plate Armor
+1 Half Plate Armor.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+1 Hand Crossbow.name: +1 Hand Crossbow
+1 Hand Crossbow.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Handaxe.name: +1 Handaxe
+1 Handaxe.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Heavy Crossbow.name: +1 Heavy Crossbow
+1 Heavy Crossbow.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Hide Armor.name: +1 Hide Armor
+1 Hide Armor.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+1 Hooked Shortspear.name: +1 Hooked Shortspear
+1 Hooked Shortspear.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Javelin.name: +1 Javelin
+1 Javelin.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Lance.name: +1 Lance
+1 Lance.text: Special: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Leather Armor.name: +1 Leather Armor
+1 Leather Armor.text: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+1 Light Crossbow.name: +1 Light Crossbow
+1 Light Crossbow.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Light Hammer.name: +1 Light Hammer
+1 Light Hammer.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Light Repeating Crossbow.name: +1 Light Repeating Crossbow
+1 Light Repeating Crossbow.text: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Longbow.name: +1 Longbow
+1 Longbow.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Longsword.name: +1 Longsword
+1 Longsword.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Mace.name: +1 Mace
+1 Mace.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Maul.name: +1 Maul
+1 Maul.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Morningstar.name: +1 Morningstar
+1 Morningstar.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Net.name: +1 Net
+1 Net.text: Special: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make. You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

+1 Padded Armor.name: +1 Padded Armor
+1 Padded Armor.text: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+1 Pike.name: +1 Pike
+1 Pike.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Plate Armor.name: +1 Plate Armor
+1 Plate Armor.text: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

+1 Quarterstaff.name: +1 Quarterstaff
+1 Quarterstaff.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Rapier.name: +1 Rapier
+1 Rapier.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Ring Mail.name: +1 Ring Mail
+1 Ring Mail.text: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+1 Scale Mail.name: +1 Scale Mail
+1 Scale Mail.text: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+1 Scimitar.name: +1 Scimitar
+1 Scimitar.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Shield.name: +1 Shield
+1 Shield.text: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time. While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

+1 Shortbow.name: +1 Shortbow
+1 Shortbow.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Shortsword.name: +1 Shortsword
+1 Shortsword.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Sickle.name: +1 Sickle
+1 Sickle.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Sling.name: +1 Sling
+1 Sling.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Sling Bullet.name: +1 Sling Bullet
+1 Sling Bullet.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Found On: Magic Item Table B

+1 Sling Bullets (20).name: +1 Sling Bullets (20)
+1 Sling Bullets (20).text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. Found On: Magic Item Table B

+1 Spear.name: +1 Spear
+1 Spear.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Spiked Armor.name: +1 Spiked Armor
+1 Spiked Armor.text: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+1 Splint Armor.name: +1 Splint Armor
+1 Splint Armor.text: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

+1 Studded Leather Armor.name: +1 Studded Leather Armor
+1 Studded Leather Armor.text: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+1 Trident.name: +1 Trident
+1 Trident.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 War Pick.name: +1 War Pick
+1 War Pick.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Warhammer.name: +1 Warhammer
+1 Warhammer.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Whip.name: +1 Whip
+1 Whip.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

+1 Yklwa.name: +1 Yklwa
+1 Yklwa.text: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table F

You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+3 Chain Mail.name: +3 Chain Mail
+3 Chain Mail.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

+3 Chain Shirt.name: +3 Chain Shirt
+3 Chain Shirt.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+3 Hide Armor.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+3 Hooked Shortspear.name: +3 Hooked Shortspear
+3 Hooked Shortspear.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

+3 Javelin.name: +3 Javelin
+3 Javelin.text: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

+3 Lance.name: +3 Lance

+3 Leather Armor.name: +3 Leather Armor
+3 Leather Armor.text: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

+3 Light Crossbow.text: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

+3 Net.name: +3 Net
+3 Net.text: Special: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make. You have a +3 bonus to attack rolls made with this weapon.

+3 Padded Armor.name: +3 Padded Armor
+3 Padded Armor.text: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+3 Pike.name: +3 Pike
+3 Pike.text: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

+3 Plate Armor.name: +3 Plate Armor
+3 Plate Armor.text: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

+3 Quarterstaff.name: +3 Quarterstaff
+3 Quarterstaff.text: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

+3 Ring Mail.name: +3 Ring Mail

Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+3 Scale Mail.name: +3 Scale Mail
+3 Scale Mail.text: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +3 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

+3 Scimitar.text: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Found On: Magic Item Table H

Acheron Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Acheron Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar
Acheron Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. The black blade of this sword is crafted from a mysterious arcane alloy. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the sword is on your person, you are immune to effects that turn undead. Dark Blessing: While holding the sword, you can use an action to give yourself 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points. This property can't be used again until the next dusk. Disheartening Strike: When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can fill the target with unsettling dread: the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn. The creature ignores this effect if it's immune to the frightened condition. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until the next dusk.

Adamantine Rapier.name: Adamantine Rapier
Adamantine Rapier.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Ring Mail.name: Adamantine Ring Mail
Adamantine Ring Mail.text: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor. This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Adamantine Scale Mail.name: Adamantine Scale Mail
Adamantine Scale Mail.text: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Adamantine Scimitar.name: Adamantine Scimitar
Adamantine Scimitar.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Shortbow.name: Adamantine Shortbow
Adamantine Shortbow.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Shortsword.name: Adamantine Shortsword
Adamantine Shortsword.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Sickle.name: Adamantine Sickle

Adamantine Sling.name: Adamantine Sling
Adamantine Sling.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Sling Bullet.name: Adamantine Sling Bullet
Adamantine Sling Bullet.text: Whenever you hit an object using this ammunition, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Sling Bullets (20).name: Adamantine Sling Bullets (20)
Adamantine Sling Bullets (20).text: Whenever you hit an object using this ammunition, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Spear.name: Adamantine Spear
Adamantine Spear.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Spiked Armor.name: Adamantine Spiked Armor
Adamantine Spiked Armor.text: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal. This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Adamantine Splint Armor.name: Adamantine Splint Armor
Adamantine Splint Armor.text: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints. This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Adamantine Trident.name: Adamantine Trident
Adamantine Trident.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine War Pick.name: Adamantine War Pick
Adamantine War Pick.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Warhammer.name: Adamantine Warhammer
Adamantine Warhammer.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Whip.name: Adamantine Whip
Adamantine Whip.text: Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Adamantine Yklwa.name: Adamantine Yklwa
Adamantine Yklwa.text: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing. Whenever you hit an object with this weapon, the hit is a critical hit.

Arrow of Slaying.name: Arrow of Slaying
Arrow of Slaying.text: An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both arrows of dragon slaying and arrows of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one. Once an arrow of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrow. Found On: Magic Item Table E

Arrows (20) of Slaying.name: Arrows (20) of Slaying
Arrows (20) of Slaying.text: An arrows (20) of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both arrows (20)s of dragon slaying and arrows (20)s of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with an arrows (20) of slaying takes damage from the arrows (20), the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one. Once an arrows (20) of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical arrows (20).

sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 276
Battleaxe Armblade.name: Battleaxe Armblade
Battleaxe Armblade.text: An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attuned to it. To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period. As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

Battleaxe of Certain Death.name: Battleaxe of Certain Death
Battleaxe of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Battleaxe of Warning.name: Battleaxe of Warning
Battleaxe of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Berserker Battleaxe.name: Berserker Battleaxe
Berserker Battleaxe.rarity: major, Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Berserker Battleaxe.text: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, while you are attuned to this weapon, your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained. Curse: This axe is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the axe, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one, unless no foe is within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear. Whenever a hostile creature damages you while the axe is in your possession, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or go berserk. While berserk, you must use your action each round to attack the creature nearest to you with the axe. If you can make extra attacks as part of the Attack action, you use those extra attacks, moving to attack the next nearest creature after you fell your current target. If you have multiple possible targets, you attack one at random. You are berserk until you start your turn with no creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both blowgun needles of dragon slaying and blowgun needles of blue dragon slaying. Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.text: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Breastplate Barding.name: Breastplate Barding
Breastplate Barding.text: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body. Any type of armor shown on the Armor table in this chapter can be purchased as barding. The cost is four times the equivalent armor made for humanoids, and it weighs twice as much.

Cast-Off Breastplate.name: Cast-Off Breastplate
Cast-Off Breastplate.text: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. You can doff this armor as an action.

Cast-Off Chain Mail.name: Cast-Off Chain Mail
Cast-Off Chain Mail.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. You can doff this armor as an action. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Cast-Off Chain Shirt.name: Cast-Off Chain Shirt
Cast-Off Chain Shirt.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. You can doff this armor as an action.

Cast-Off Half Plate Armor.name: Cast-Off Half Plate Armor
Cast-Off Half Plate Armor.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. You can doff this armor as an action. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Cast-Off Hide Armor.name: Cast-Off Hide Armor
Cast-Off Hide Armor.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. You can doff this armor as an action.

Cast-Off Leather Armor.name: Cast-Off Leather Armor
Cast-Off Leather Armor.text: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials. You can doff this armor as an action.

Cast-Off Padded Armor.name: Cast-Off Padded Armor
Cast-Off Padded Armor.text: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting. You can doff this armor as an action. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Cast-Off Plate Armor.name: Cast-Off Plate Armor
Cast-Off Plate Armor.text: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body. You can doff this armor as an action. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Cast-Off Ring Mail.name: Cast-Off Ring Mail

The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Cast-Off Splint Armor.name: Cast-Off Splint Armor
Cast-Off Splint Armor.text: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints. You can doff this armor as an action. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Cast-Off Studded Leather Armor.name: Cast-Off Studded Leather Armor
Cast-Off Studded Leather Armor.text: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes. You can doff this armor as an action.

This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. This armor never gets dirty.

sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 276
Club Armblade.name: Club Armblade
Club Armblade.text: An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attuned to it. To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period. As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

Club of Certain Death.name: Club of Certain Death
Club of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Club of Warning.name: Club of Warning
Club of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Corpse Slayer Battleaxe.name: Corpse Slayer Battleaxe
Corpse Slayer Battleaxe.text: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead creature with an attack using this weapon, the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's type, and the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead until the start of your next turn.

Corpse Slayer Hooked Shortspear.name: Corpse Slayer Hooked Shortspear
Corpse Slayer Hooked Shortspear.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead creature with an attack using this weapon, the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's type, and the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead until the start of your next turn.

Corpse Slayer Lance.text: Special: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted. Corpse Slayer Light Repeating Crossbow.name: Corpse Slayer Light Repeating Crossbow
Corpse Slayer Light Repeating Crossbow.text: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Corpse Slayer Net.name: Corpse Slayer Net
Corpse Slayer Net.text: Special: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead creature with an attack using this weapon, the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's type, and the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead until the start of your next turn.

Corpse Slayer Yklwa.name: Corpse Slayer Yklwa
Corpse Slayer Yklwa.text: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead creature with an attack using this weapon, the attack deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's type, and the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead until the start of your next turn.

Crossbow Bolt of Slaying.name: Crossbow Bolt of Slaying
Crossbow Bolt of Slaying.text: A crossbow bolt of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both crossbow bolts of dragon slaying and crossbow bolts of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with a crossbow bolt of slaying takes damage from the crossbow bolt, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one. Once a crossbow bolt of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical crossbow bolt.

Crossbow Bolts (20) of Slaying.name: Crossbow Bolts (20) of Slaying
Crossbow Bolts (20) of Slaying.text: A crossbow bolts (20) of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both crossbow bolts (20)s of dragon slaying and crossbow bolts (20)s of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with a crossbow bolts (20) of slaying takes damage from the crossbow bolts (20), the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one. Once a crossbow bolts (20) of slaying deals its extra damage to a creature, it becomes a nonmagical crossbow bolts (20).

Crystal.name: Crystal
Crystal.text: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus.

To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period. As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

Dagger of Certain Death.name: Dagger of Certain Death
Dagger of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Dagger of Warning.name: Dagger of Warning
Dagger of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Dancing Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Dancing Double-Bladed Scimitar
Dancing Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You can use a bonus action to toss this magic sword into the air and speak the command word. When you do so, the sword begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of it. The sword uses your attack roll and ability score modifier to damage rolls. While the sword hovers, you can use a bonus action to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you. As part of the same bonus action, you can cause the sword to attack one creature within 5 feet of it. After the hovering sword attacks for the fourth time, it flies up to 30 feet and tries to return to your hand. If you have no hand free, it falls to the ground at your feet. If the sword has no unobstructed path to you, it moves as close to you as it can and then falls to the ground. It also ceases to hover if you grasp it or move more than 30 feet away from it. Found On: Magic Item Table H

This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The first time you attack with the sword on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the sword's bonus to your Armor Class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. For example, you could reduce the bonus to your attack and damage rolls to +1 and gain a +2 bonus to AC. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the sword to gain a bonus to AC from it. Found On: Magic Item Table I

sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 21
Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4.

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Certain Death.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Certain Death
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Certain Death.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Life Stealing.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Life Stealing
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Life Stealing.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 10 necrotic damage if it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 temporary hit points. Note: According to the SRD, it is an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Sharpness.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Sharpness
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Sharpness.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. When you attack an object with this magic sword and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target. When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 slashing damage. Then roll another d20. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead. Note: According to the SRD, it is an extra 4d6 slashing damage, although this is incorrect (https://twitter.com/JeremyECrawford/status/949111823990534144). In addition, you can speak the sword's command to cause the blade to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Speaking the command word again or sheathing the sword puts out the light. Found On: Magic Item Table H

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Vengeance.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Vengeance
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Vengeance.rarity: major, Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Vengeance.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Curse: This sword is cursed and possessed by a vengeful spirit. Becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the sword, keeping it on your person at all times. While attuned to this weapon, you have disadvantage on attack rolls made with weapons other than this one. In addition, while the sword is on your person, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw whenever you take damage in combat. On a failed save you must attack the creature that damaged you until you drop to 0 hit points or it does, or until you can't reach the creature to make a melee attack against it. You can break the curse in the usual ways. Alternatively, casting banishment on the sword forces the vengeful spirit to leave it. The sword then becomes a +1 weapon with no other properties. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Warning.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Warning
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Warning.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Double-Bladed Scimitar of Wounding.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of Wounding
Double-Bladed Scimitar of Wounding.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Double-Bladed Scimitar of the Medusa.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar of the Medusa
Double-Bladed Scimitar of the Medusa.rarity: Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Double-Bladed Scimitar of the Medusa.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, the creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw in addition to suffering the attack's normal effects. On a failed save, the creature is restrained and must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this effect three times, the effect ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the petrified condition for 1 hour. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to damage of the weapon's type, does not have a body made of flesh, or has legendary actions. Curse: This weapon is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. Until the curse is broken with a remove curse spell or similar magic, you are unwilling to part with the weapon. Whenever you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 1 on the attack roll, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be restrained and forced to make additional saves against being petrified, as above.

Dragon Slayer Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Dragon Slayer Double-Bladed Scimitar
Dragon Slayer Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 damage of the weapon's type. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Drow +1 Battleaxe.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Blowgun.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Breastplate.name: Drow +1 Breastplate
Drow +1 Breastplate.text: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Chain Mail.name: Drow +1 Chain Mail
Drow +1 Chain Mail.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Drow +1 Chain Shirt.name: Drow +1 Chain Shirt
Drow +1 Chain Shirt.text: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Hide Armor.name: Drow +1 Hide Armor
Drow +1 Hide Armor.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Hooked Shortspear.name: Drow +1 Hooked Shortspear
Drow +1 Hooked Shortspear.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Javelin.name: Drow +1 Javelin
Drow +1 Javelin.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Lance.name: Drow +1 Lance
Drow +1 Lance.text: Special: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Leather Armor.name: Drow +1 Leather Armor
Drow +1 Leather Armor.text: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Light Repeating Crossbow.text: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Pike.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Plate Armor.name: Drow +1 Plate Armor
Drow +1 Plate Armor.text: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Drow +1 Quarterstaff.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Rapier.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Ring Mail.name: Drow +1 Ring Mail
Drow +1 Ring Mail.text: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Drow +1 Scale Mail.text: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Drow +1 Spiked Armor.text: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Drow +1 Splint Armor.name: Drow +1 Splint Armor
Drow +1 Splint Armor.text: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

Drow +1 Studded Leather Armor.name: Drow +1 Studded Leather Armor
Drow +1 Studded Leather Armor.text: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes. You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. This armor loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Trident.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Whip.text: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Drow +1 Yklwa.name: Drow +1 Yklwa
Drow +1 Yklwa.text: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. This weapon loses its enchantment bonus permanently if it is exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer.

Fernian Ash Rod.name: Fernian Ash Rod
Fernian Ash Rod.text: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus. An imbued wood focus is a rod, staff, or wand cut from a tree infused with extraplanar energy. If you're a spellcaster, you can use this item as a spellcasting focus. When you cast a damage-dealing spell using this item as your spellcasting focus, you gain a +1 bonus to one fire damage roll of the spell.
sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 277

Fernian Basalt Crystal.name: Fernian Basalt Crystal
Fernian Basalt Crystal.text: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus. An orb of shielding is a polished, spherical chunk of crystal or stone aligned to one of the planes of existence. If you're a spellcaster, you can use this orb as a spellcasting focus. If you're holding the orb when you take fire damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d4 (to a minimum of 0).
sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 278

Flail Armblade.name: Flail Armblade
Flail Armblade.text: An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attuned to it. To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period. As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

Flail of Certain Death.name: Flail of Certain Death
Flail of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Flail of Warning.name: Flail of Warning
Flail of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Flame Tongue Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Flame Tongue Double-Bladed Scimitar
Flame Tongue Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Frost Brand Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Frost Brand Double-Bladed Scimitar
Frost Brand Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. When you hit with an attack using this magic sword, the target takes an extra 1d6 cold damage. In addition, while you hold the sword, you have resistance to fire damage. In freezing temperatures, the blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. When you draw this weapon, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of you. This property can be used no more than once per hour. Found On: Magic Item Table H

Gambler's Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Gambler's Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar
Gambler's Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar.rarity: Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Gambler's Blade Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. Choose a magical bonus of +1 to +3. This sword gains that bonus to its attack and damage rolls. For each point of bonus you choose for the sword, you take a corresponding penalty (-1 to -3) to your death saving throws. You can change this magical bonus each day at dawn. Curse: This weapon is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. Until the curse is broken with a remove curse spell or similar magic, you are unwilling to part with the weapon.

Giant Slayer Battleaxe.name: Giant Slayer Battleaxe
Giant Slayer Battleaxe.text: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a giant with it, the giant takes an extra 2d6 damage of the weapon's type and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall prone. For the purpose of this weapon, "giant" refers to any creature with the giant type, including ettins and trolls. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Greatsword of Certain Death.name: Greatsword of Certain Death
Greatsword of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Greatsword of Life Stealing.name: Greatsword of Life Stealing
Greatsword of Life Stealing.text: When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 10 necrotic damage if it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 temporary hit points. Note: According to the SRD, it is an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Greatsword of Sharpness.name: Greatsword of Sharpness
Greatsword of Sharpness.text: When you attack an object with this magic sword and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target. When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 slashing damage. Then roll another d20. If you roll a 20, you lop off one of the target's limbs, with the effect of such loss determined by the DM. If the creature has no limb to sever, you lop off a portion of its body instead. Note: According to the SRD, it is an extra 4d6 slashing damage, although this is incorrect (https://twitter.com/JeremyECrawford/status/949111823990534144). In addition, you can speak the sword's command to cause the blade to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Speaking the command word again or sheathing the sword puts out the light. Found On: Magic Item Table H

Greatsword of Vengeance.name: Greatsword of Vengeance
Greatsword of Vengeance.rarity: major, Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Greatsword of Vengeance.text: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Curse: This sword is cursed and possessed by a vengeful spirit. Becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the sword, keeping it on your person at all times. While attuned to this weapon, you have disadvantage on attack rolls made with weapons other than this one. In addition, while the sword is on your person, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw whenever you take damage in combat. On a failed save you must attack the creature that damaged you until you drop to 0 hit points or it does, or until you can't reach the creature to make a melee attack against it. You can break the curse in the usual ways. Alternatively, casting banishment on the sword forces the vengeful spirit to leave it. The sword then becomes a +1 weapon with no other properties. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Greatsword of Warning.name: Greatsword of Warning
Greatsword of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Greatsword of Wounding.name: Greatsword of Wounding
Greatsword of Wounding.text: Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can be regained only through a short or long rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success. Found On: Magic Item Table G

Greatsword of the Medusa.name: Greatsword of the Medusa
Greatsword of the Medusa.rarity: Cursed item, martial Weapon, Melee Weapon
Greatsword of the Medusa.text: When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, the creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw in addition to suffering the attack's normal effects. On a failed save, the creature is restrained and must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this effect three times, the effect ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the petrified condition for 1 hour. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to damage of the weapon's type, does not have a body made of flesh, or has legendary actions. Curse: This weapon is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. Until the curse is broken with a remove curse spell or similar magic, you are unwilling to part with the weapon. Whenever you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 1 on the attack roll, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be restrained and forced to make additional saves against being petrified, as above.

Halberd of Certain Death.name: Halberd of Certain Death
Halberd of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Half Plate Armor.name: Half Plate Armor
Half Plate Armor.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Half Plate Armor Barding.name: Half Plate Armor Barding
Half Plate Armor Barding.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body. Any type of armor shown on the Armor table in this chapter can be purchased as barding. The cost is four times the equivalent armor made for humanoids, and it weighs twice as much. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks.

Half Plate Armor of Acid Resistance.name: Half Plate Armor of Acid Resistance
Half Plate Armor of Acid Resistance.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. You have resistance to acid damage while you wear this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. Found On: Magic Item Table I

It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. You have resistance to psychic damage while you wear this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. Found On: Magic Item Table I

Half Plate Armor of Radiant Resistance.name: Half Plate Armor of Radiant Resistance
Half Plate Armor of Radiant Resistance.text: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps. You have resistance to radiant damage while you wear this armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. Found On: Magic Item Table I

The wearer has disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks. Found On: Magic Item Table I

Hand Crossbow of Certain Death.name: Hand Crossbow of Certain Death
Hand Crossbow of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Hand Crossbow of Warning.name: Hand Crossbow of Warning
Hand Crossbow of Warning.text: This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 276
Handaxe Armblade.name: Handaxe Armblade
Handaxe Armblade.text: An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attuned to it. To attune to this item, you must hold it against your forearm for the entire attunement period. As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

Handaxe of Certain Death.name: Handaxe of Certain Death
Handaxe of Certain Death.text: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

sources: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 223
Hellfire Battleaxe.name: Hellfire Battleaxe
Hellfire Battleaxe.text: This weapon is fashioned from infernal iron and traced with veins of hellfire that shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius. Any humanoid killed by an attack made with this weapon has its soul funneled into the River Styx, where it's reborn instantly as a lemure devil.

Hellfire Light Repeating Crossbow.name: Hellfire Light Repeating Crossbow
Hellfire Light Repeating Crossbow.text: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action. This weapon is fashioned from infernal iron and traced with veins of hellfire that shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius. Any humanoid killed by an attack made with this weapon has its soul funneled into the River Styx, where it's reborn instantly as a lemure devil.

sources: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 223
Hellfire Net.name: Hellfire Net
Hellfire Net.text: Special: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is restrained until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make. This weapon is fashioned from infernal iron and traced with veins of hellfire that shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius. Any humanoid killed by an attack made with this weapon has its soul funneled into the River Styx, where it's reborn instantly as a lemure devil.

sources: Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 223
Hellfire Yklwa.name: Hellfire Yklwa
Hellfire Yklwa.text: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing. This weapon is fashioned from infernal iron and traced with veins of hellfire that shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius. Any humanoid killed by an attack made with this weapon has its soul funneled into the River Styx, where it's reborn instantly as a lemure devil.

Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
Hide Armor.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Hide Armor Barding.name: Hide Armor Barding
Hide Armor Barding.text: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor. Barding is armor designed to protect an animal's head, neck, chest, and body. Any type of armor shown on the Armor table in this chapter can be purchased as barding. The cost is four times the equivalent armor made for humanoids, and it weighs twice as much.

Holy Avenger Double-Bladed Scimitar.name: Holy Avenger Double-Bladed Scimitar
Holy Avenger Double-Bladed Scimitar.text: Special: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals 1d4 slashing damage on a hit, instead of 2d4. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a fiend or an undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage. While you hold the drawn sword, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet. Found On: Magic Item Table I

Hooked Shortspear of Certain Death.name: Hooked Shortspear of Certain Death
Hooked Shortspear of Certain Death.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Hooked Shortspear of Warning.name: Hooked Shortspear of Warning
Hooked Shortspear of Warning.text: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus. This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins. Found On: Magic Item Table F

Irian Quartz Crystal.name: Irian Quartz Crystal
Irian Quartz Crystal.text: An arcane focus is a special item designed to channel the power of arcane spells. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard can use such an item as a spellcasting focus. An orb of shielding is a polished, spherical chunk of crystal or stone aligned to one of the planes of existence. If you're a spellcaster, you can use this orb as a spellcasting focus. If you're holding the orb when you take radiant damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d4 (to a minimum of 0).
sources: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 278

Irian Quartz Orb.name: Irian Quartz Orb
